50 years of powerful Bay Area posters collected by Oakland library go online

Over the past 50 years, librarians at the then-called Latin American branch in Oakland’s Fruitvale neighborhood have collected a trove of political, cultural and educational posters made by Bay Area artists and organizations. Now the César E. Chávez library is "returning” them to the community by putting them online.
